lead_paragraph: With the Islamic State down to three neighborhoods in the coastal city of Surt, the question becomes: How will this nation of many factions be governed?

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Berlin.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and NOUR YOUSSEF

headline.print_headline: Unified Against Fading Islamic State, Libya Remains Nation of Factions
headline.main: Libya: Unified Against ISIS, Fragmented After

snippet: With the Islamic State down to three neighborhoods in the coastal city of Surt, the question becomes: How will this nation of many factions be governed?...
abstract: Success of militias dispatched by United Nations-backed government in Libya in fighting back against Islamic State has put question of how country will be governed back in spotlight; Libya has been divided by tribal and militia rivalries ever since Col Muammar el-Qaddafi was deposed, and threat Islamic State presented was only reason why those factions worked together.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
